item.description:
We will continue our discussion of "Diamond Sutra Explained" by Master Nan Huai-Chin. published by Primordia, 2004. This paperback is readily available through Barnes & Nobles, Amazon and other booksellers.

Please read Chapter 17 to the end of the book.

Master Nan Huai-Chin’s discourses on the treasured Buddhist Diamond Sutra bring together a lifetime of personal cultivation experience that crosses into several schools of esoteric and spiritual practice. This great contemporary Zen Master uses the Diamond Sutra as a tool to gauge the understanding that we must have when journeying towards understanding our true selves. The various passages from this beautiful Sutra are used to provide the student with a framework that combines understanding with practical cultivation. Master Nan’s teachings are uniquely different compared with interpretations given by other contemporary and past teachers.

Note: "Diamond Sutra Explained" includes a translation of the Diamond Sutra by Master Nan Huai-Chin's translator and editor, Hue En (Pia Giammasi). There are several other translations of the Sutra available in English. Readily available and recommended is our member Alex Johnson's translation. Click on "More" on the Manchester Buddhism Sangha website, then on "Files" to download this PDF document.
